Since 2008, the country has carried out three major redenominations, removing a total of fourteen zeros from the currency in repeated attempts to simplify transactions and restore trust.  Today, one bol√≠var digital is equivalent to 100 trillion of the original pre-2008 bol√≠vares. For millions of Venezuelans, the 14 zeros eliminated remain a painful symbol of a prolonged economic crisis. The hope now rests on whether genuine, broad-based reforms can finally bring lasting stability.
